title: Need help for font ID!
content:
Hi All,

Really need help with these two attachments. One is SOL and the other is number 88. Would really appreciate your help. Thank you!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ASD.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828223318/http:/typophile.com/files/ASD_0.JPG) | 11.05 KB |
| [sans-titre-9a.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828223318/http:/typophile.com/files/sans-titre-9a_0.png) | 15.94 KB |
author: atpf08

comments.content: Having a look to [College](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828223318/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Acollege)/ [Athletic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828223318/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Aathletic)/ [Varsity](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828223318/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Avarsity/)/ [Octagonal](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828223318/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Aoctagonal/fonts/) fonts at MyFonts might be helpful.

Here's my pick for your dream team: [Return Pass JNL Regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828223318/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/return-pass/). For an exact match you need to reduce the width slightly while retaining the stroke thickness. There are several inline fonts that are otherwise good matches, Princetown by Letraset, Linotype, and Scangraphic, Campus by Mecanorma.  
Don
